Hi Tom,

> Well, I have enough raw data for the work I was doing: it's a pitty
> the state directory is so big. Guess I need to get around to writing
> that script to keep the ARCs on a separate disk from the rest.

Just FYI: You can configure the ARC writer processor to write ARC files directly to any disk you 
want. Usually, I configure the crawls where the logs+conf are written to one disk (e.g. <string 
name="disk-path">/1/crawldata/aCrawl</string>) and ARC files on another (e.g. <stringList 
name="path"><string>/2/crawldata/aCrawl/arcs</string></stringList>). Notice that in stringList you 
can specify more than one disk if needed.

Also, splitting logs, state and arc files to different disks is a good practice since the disk I/O 
is split among different disks.

Take care,
i.
